text: How do you all handle using modern versions of Bootstrap (eg: v4) in custom modules, when drag and drop modules are using the watered down Bootstrap 2? Is there a best practice to integrating Bootstrap 4?

We donâ€™t even use bootstrap anymore, stopped in 2015. We built our own framework that works better for us. Maybe <@U25C65C3S> can chime in on how his team is killing it, I think they are using bootstrap.
We have some translations for the bootstrap 2 to tie into the med widths. From there we build as normal and add in addition styles for different device widths in the modules

So you import a modern version of Bootstrap into a template that's already using the default BS2? Do you build custom modules using BS4 and have no issues with the different versions of BS conflicting?
<@UFL9XN2DQ> not that i've seen. For new builds we only use HubSpot's default's and then add BS4 to it

So im having an issue with the nav menu module when using it for breadcrumbs. I have a site, where the menu should be showing but its coming up blank. I have it set to three deep and it shows for levels 1-2 only... thoughts?
nevermind, looks like menu was never published. :faceplam:
may be worth peeking at the open source CSS HubSpot framework <#CCQSQ2C6L|crankshaft> <@UFL9XN2DQ>
